intro: Zehneria guamensis, commonly known as the Guam zehneria, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Guam in the Western Pacific. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to habitat loss and other environmental pressures, it is considered endangered and is protected by local conservation efforts.
